company_context: PostgreSQL: The world's most advanced open source database February 16, 2026: Out-of-cycle release scheduled for February 26, 2026 PostgreSQL: The World's Most Advanced Open Source Relational Database Download New to PostgreSQL? New to PostgreSQL? PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system with over 35 years of active development that has earned it a strong reputation for reliability, feature robustness, and performance. There is a wealth of information to be found describing how to install and use PostgreSQL through the official documentation . The open source community provides many helpful places to become familiar with PostgreSQL, discover how it works, and find career opportunities. Learn more on how to engage with the community . Learn More Feature Matrix Governance Latest Releases 2026-02-12 - PostgreSQL 18.2, 17.8, 16.12, 15.16, and 14.21 Released! The PostgreSQL Global Development Group has released an update to all supported versions of PostgreSQL, including 18.2, 17.8, 16.12, 15.16, and 14.21. This release fixes 5 security vulnerabilities and over 65 bugs reported over the last several months. You can find details on the fixes in the release notes . For the more information about this release, please review the release notes . You can download PostgreSQL from the download page. For more information on PostgreSQL 18, the latest major version of PostgreSQL, please see the full press release and translations of the release announcement in the press kit . 18.2 · 2026-02-12 · Notes 17.8 · 2026-02-12 · Notes 16.12 · 2026-02-12 · Notes 15.16 · 2026-02-12 · Notes 14.21 · 2026-02-12 · Notes Download Why Upgrade? Security Upcoming Events 2026-03-05 – 2026-03-06 · PostgreSQL@SCaLE23x 2026-03-10 · FOSSASIA PGDay 2026 2026-03-11 – 2026-03-13 · PGConf India 2026 2026-03-19 · PG BootCamp Russia 2026 2026-03-26 · pgDay Paris 2026 2026-04-21 – 2026-04-22 · PostgreSQL Conference Germany 2026 2026-04-26 – 2026-04-28 · HOW2026: PostgreSQL & IvorySQL Ecosystem Conference indicates that an event is recognised under the community event guidelines and is directly helping the PostgreSQL community. Check Schedule Add Your Event Mailing Lists The PostgreSQL mailing lists enable you to interact with active community participants on subjects related to the development of PostgreSQL, discovering how to use PostgreSQL, or learning about upcoming events and product releases. In order to manage your mailing list subscription, you need a PostgreSQL community account . Signing up is easy and gives you direct access to the global PostgreSQL community . Subscribe View Archives Learning Opportunities Ahead Want to learn more about PostgreSQL and help build the community? Come to one of the many events, local user groups, & training sessions where you can meet experienced PostgreSQL users and enhance your database skills. conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex and I'm reaching out from DeepData AI. We're a data processing solution that helps companies like yours optimize their database performance. I saw that you're using PostgreSQL and I wanted to explore if our solution could be a good fit for your team.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (sighs) Another sales call. What makes you think we need your solution? We've been using PostgreSQL for years and it's been working just fine for us.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand that PostgreSQL is a reliable database system, but our solution can help you unlock even more value from your data. We've worked with several companies that use PostgreSQL and have seen significant improvements in query performance and data insights. I'd love to schedule a demo to show you what we can do.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (skeptical) I'm not sure if we're in the market for a new solution right now. We're actually in the middle of planning our budget for the next quarter, and I don't think we have the resources to invest in something new. Plus, we're about to upgrade to the latest version of PostgreSQL, so I'm not sure if your solution would be compatible.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand your concerns about budget and timing. However, our solution is designed to be compatible with the latest versions of PostgreSQL, and we've actually worked with several companies that have recently upgraded. As for budget, I'd be happy to discuss pricing with you and see if we can find a package that fits your needs. We also offer a free trial, so you can test our solution before committing to anything.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (hesitant) I'm still not convinced. What sets you apart from other data processing solutions on the market? We've looked at a few other options and they seem to offer similar features.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: That's a great question. What sets us apart is our AI-powered engine that can learn and adapt to your specific database needs. We've seen significant improvements in performance and insights for our customers, and we're confident that we can do the same for you. I'd love to schedule a demo to show you exactly how our solution works and how it can benefit your team.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (firmly) Look, I appreciate the pitch, but I don't think we're interested in moving forward with DeepData AI at this time. We're going to focus on our upgrade to the latest version of PostgreSQL and see how that goes before exploring other solutions. Thanks for reaching out, but I think we'll have to pass.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand, and I appreciate your honesty. If you change your mind or have any questions in the future, don't hesitate to reach out. Have a great day!

analysis.raw:
Score: 4
Outcome: Failure
Key_Objection: Timing
Feedback: The seller should have more aggressively addressed the buyer's concerns about timing and budget by providing more specific examples or case studies of how their solution can help during a database upgrade. Sentiment: Neutral
